text: Hi Pedram! Sorry for the late reply, thank you for connecting and that's amazing! Yeah, i'm just about to finish my degree in VFX, specialising in compositing and roto/prep. Have you always been a compositor or did you work your way up through running or prep work?
No problem at all, awesome good to know you're on the right track!
No i actually studied games development in university
I then went on to an internship at Blue Zoo and discovered the world of Animation/vfx
about a year later i decided i wanted to do comp and started off with After Effects, i actually managed to avoid working as a roto/prep artist all together by moving around a lot
Its quite a long story but i studied Nuke during my own time after about 2 years of doing AE work and slowly shifted over as the nuke work started to roll in
The typical route however would indeed be to start off roto/prep at a studio and work your way up the compositing ladder

Ahh quite a varied career so far then! Yeah I actually really enjoy prep work and have tried to use all my projects to show off my skills in it so far because I'm expecting to start in that area. The end goal would be to become a compositor in London like yourself haha

Yeah prep can be really fun and almost therapeutic. Definitely include a lot of that in uni projects like you said. Also try get some CG/matte painting work in there to vary it up. Have you applied for any roles yet?

Yeah that's true, I'm a terrible matte painter but trying to incorporate elements together for one of my shots for my final major project. I've had multipass comp in all of my projects this year though,is there anything else I should try to include for my showreel etc?
In fact, if possible, could I please send you my showreel and get some feedback on what skills you think I should show more of?
